@hjafarpour Can you please avoid all those whitespace changes...

A freshly cloned Kafka source tree after the `./gradlew eclipse` command had run is full of files that git tells you to commit, while it'd be nice if the tree was clean.
This PR is not enough to have a clean tree, the Eclipse projects classpaths also need to be fixed but that is, a set of different issues:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4604
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4617
@ijuma for reviews.

@ewencp @ijuma 

The build failed is unrelated to this PR. Could you please review again ?
ping @enothereska @dguy @mjsax for reviews.

Also by doing this PR now I see more failures that is being worked on with https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2371. This is because now Streams rebalance gets shorter and the race condition is then more likely to happen.
retest this please.

Looking at the parsing code more carefully, I think it can be improved so that some of these errors are impossible. It's weird that we accept Strings, but not small Longs if the type is `Int`, for example. I think it would be better if we accepted any numeric type as long the value was within the expected range. Thoughts?

@hachikuji If this patch isn't going to be useful, maybe close the PR? And do you have thoughts on the JIRA? If we're not addressing it in 0.10.2 then I'm going to remove the version. I also suspect we can reduce the priority given that we haven't gotten to it for so long (it started with fix version 0.10.0.0). @ijuma do you have thoughts since you were the one that originally bumped priority from major to critical? I haven't noticed many mailing list questions about this.

Found another issue with `SegmentIteratorTest`, where the test could be opening the underlying `Segment`'s iterator without closing it at the end if it is not calling `hasNext` until it returns false.
